comments: We do not know why, but Uwe got this in a Log file from a nightly unit test run: It looks like in the following code: File[] children = _baseFolder.listFiles(); for (int i = 0; i < children.length; i++) { children is null. Actually, java.io.File.listFiles() Javadoc says: Returns null if this abstract pathname does not denote a directory, or if an I/O error occurs. so it is valid to return null and the code must handle this case. I think this is an important bug to fix, because such errors writing the Profile can lead to loss of data and might actually be the reason for invalid profiles on disk like in bug #202416 . > [exec] java.lang.NullPointerException > [exec] at > org.eclipse.rse.internal.persistence.PFMetadataLocation.keepChildren(PFM > etadataLocation.java:90) > [exec] at > org.eclipse.rse.internal.persistence.PropertyFileProvider.saveNode(Prope > rtyFileProvider.java:222) > [exec] at > org.eclipse.rse.internal.persistence.PropertyFileProvider.saveNode(Prope > rtyFileProvider.java:217) > [exec] at > org.eclipse.rse.internal.persistence.PropertyFileProvider.saveNode(Prope > rtyFileProvider.java:217) > [exec] at > org.eclipse.rse.internal.persistence.PropertyFileProvider.saveNode(Prope > rtyFileProvider.java:217) > [exec] at > org.eclipse.rse.internal.persistence.PropertyFileProvider.saveRSEDOM(Pro > pertyFileProvider.java:115) > [exec] at > org.eclipse.rse.internal.persistence.PFMetatdataJob.run(PFMetatdataJob.j > ava:62) > [exec] at > org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55) -----------Enter bugs above this line----------- TM 2.0.1 Testing installation : eclipse-SDK-3.3-linux-gtk-x86_64, emf-sdo-xsd-SDK-2.3.0 Download RSE-2.0.1RC1: RSE-SDK,examples,tests,discovery,terminal java.runtime : Sun 1.5.0_12-b04 64-bit Server VM, mixed mode os.name: : OpenSUSE 10.2 64-bit uname : Linux osgiliath 2.6.18.8-0.5-default x86_64 GNU/Linux ------------------------------------------------ systemtype : Linux-local / Unix-dstore (RExec) / FTP / Ssh targetos1 : Linux RHEL4, Sun 1.5.0_11 targetos2 : Windows XP SP1, Sun 1.4.2_13 targetos3 : Solaris-sparc 5.9, Sun 1.4.2_05 targetuname : SunOS szg-anar 5.9 Generic_118558-06 sun4u sparc SUNW,Sun-Blade-1500 ------------------------------------------------
